solution_line_template: In the morning he travels at an average speed of {morning_speed}mph for {morning_time} hour so he covers a distance of {morning_speed}*{morning_time} = <<{morning_speed}*{morning_time}={distance_to_work}>>{distance_to_work} miles

He covers the same distance of {distance_to_work} miles in the evening spending {evening_time} hours so his average speed must be {distance_to_work}/{evening_time} = <<{distance_to_work}/{evening_time}={evening_speed}>>{evening_speed}mph
